title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altarum
Interview Descriptions: A disorganized process of false promises, no clear timelines and unprofessional behavior. The process took about 9 weeks, across 5 interviews with HR, Hiring Manager, Cross-functional team leads, Senior Management, project management interview. I was told the process would take no more than 3 weeks. The recruiting team I found quite unprofessional and unable to stick to schedules, or even respect the time of candidates. After being called several times in one day by the same person, who was unwilling to schedule a call via email, I grew tired of the back-n-forth. Although I had spent the last 2 months going through this tiring interview process, I decided this wasn't the right environment for me.
Interview Questions: How do you handle competing priorities? How do you deal with ambiguity?

title: Assoicate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Altarum in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was unprofessional and a waste of time. I had a phone interview with the recruiter. During the interview, I specifically asked if there were any assignments I would have to do, and she assured me there weren't. I then had my final panel interview and was told I would receive the decision by the end of the week. At the end of the week, the senior talent acquisition team leader asked if I would complete a writing exercise. I was hesitant and mentioned how this writing exercise was never mentioned, as I believe any company that wants you to do take-home assignments is not worth working for. I submit the writing exercise and then have to reach back out to the talent accusation team leader because she does not get back to me about an update. She then tells me how they are moving forward with another candidate, but another role has opened, and she asks if I would be interested. I tell her, yes, and then I never hear from her again. It was a blessing in disguise because I ended up receiving two job offers from different companies. The lack of professionalism, communication, and run around from this company tells me everything I needed to know. I will not be applying here in the future.
Interview Questions: Lots of behavioral questions Tell me about a time when...?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altarum (Fort Collins, CO) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, asked about background and why I wanted the position. Asked about experiences would contribute to the role. Would I be comfortable working outside my area of expertise? How would I handle it if I didn’t agree with others?
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altarum
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward. I interviewed with a department head first and the second interview was with her again and the person who would be managing my contract. They were friendly and explained the position and expectations up front.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions and then how I would logically solve problems.

title: Public Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Altarum
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth. Had an initial phone screening with HR and within 2 weeks I was scheduled for a Zoom interview with the team. It was 2 people who interviewed me and it was more conversational and background related questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you’ve dealt with conflict

title: Deputy Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Altarum in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted the job application, HR reached out to tell me the position had been filled, but asked to include my resume in a grant application for ad hoc work, without interviewing me first over the phone or giving me any real details about what the ad hoc work would involve. I politely declined for my resume to be included in their outside grant application. A few weeks later HR contacted me to inform me she was confused earlier and the position was still open. I had a nice interview with the hiring manager but the job wasn't a good fit, and a few days later I got a rejection via email.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with working with technical/technological teams?

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Altarum in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Typical panel interview with several people in attendance. It was very pleasant and conversational and there was a lot of questions and answers being shared back-and-forth. Low pressure and very comfortable, took about two hours
Interview Questions: About previous relevant experience that i would bring.

title: Client Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altarum (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Apply online via the job portal, first round interview is by phone and if they are interested will invite you in for an in person interview.  There are usually 3 people involved, center leadership, and a couple program managers or program support staff.  Received offer about 4 days after the second interview.
Interview Questions: Interview questions are mostly about your past work experience and how you would fit in the company.

title: Research Analyst Interview

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Altarum in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It has become evident from reading other comments, that this company's HR staff is completely unprofessional. I was contacted by a recruiter and was asked to complete a few questions. Emailed my information back the same day and complete silence for almost a month. I emailed the recruiter to let her know, I was still interested in the position and she responded back stating that the hiring team was traveling and wouldn't be able to set up interviews until they were back in the office but as soon as they were available, she would set up an interview. That never happened. So, I followed up a month later and the recruiter completely ignored my email. Never heard back at all. Your employees are a direct reflection of your company and your HR staff is the "face" of your company as well. If you want to make a good impression on potential candidates, please train your HR staff to be more professional. I understand that your job may get a little busy but it doesn't take five minutes to respond to an email.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Java Developer Interview

title: Project Coordinator Interview

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Altarum (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: They moved very quickly at first. I got an email to set up a phone interview a few days after applying online. The phone interview went well, and I was set up for an in person interview the next week. The interview was scheduled for a Monday, and I was told to call on the Friday before to go over the format of the interview, etc. I called multiple times, left voicemails, and no one returned my call. I went in for the interview, and was told I would hear something back the next day. No one contacted me, so I waited a week, and contacted them to find out the status of my application. No one ever responded. It seems like they don't value the people they interview, and they could use a lot of help with communication.
Interview Questions: Just regular interview questions

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Altarum (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with Recruiter first, then in-person with HR and Hiring Manager a month later, then in-person with Hiring Manager and additional personnel 2-3 weeks later presenting examples of my work as requested. Interviews were rescheduled by the company at the last minute. Was told they would be making their decision in a week or so, that I had all the skills they were looking for and that they would get back with me. I never heard anything back to let me know one way or the other, and follow-up email and phone messages (calls went to voice mail) weeks later all went into a black hole unanswered. They are very busy people that don't have time to return a simple courtesy for a very large investment of time by the interviewee.
Interview Questions: The interview is both very easy and very hard, as there is 'something' they are looking for that you have no clue about.
